Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “The disorder we are witnessing, especially in our downtown area, has many causes and impacts,” Evans wrote the selectboard in a recent memorandum.
“You have a lot of people looking for help,” Evans said, “but there’s a small percentage that, for whatever reason, are unable or unwilling to accept it.”
“Unfortunately, many of those are providers,” Evans said, “which creates a huge, huge problem.”
“This is something that we see in a lot of different jurisdictions,” Robin Joy, the Crime Research Group’s statistical director, told local leaders at another meeting.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: A study by the Vermont nonprofit Crime Research Group shows Brattleboro police are dispatched most to the local Quality Inn, where the state is housing people otherwise without shelter (authorities received 181 calls there in the first half of this year), as well as to such downtown locations as the Whetstone path park (112 calls so far in 2024), the Groundworks Collaborative shelter (93) and Transportation Center parking garage (57).
Groundworks Collaborative, for example, helps local people without permanent housing (its outreach team reports contact with 159 such individuals so far this year).
